title: How to move a button in Pygame - Quora

response.answer_text: When I saw your question, I went, “PyGame has buttons!?” And … it doesn’t. That’s not to say you can’t implement buttons using PyGame which I have done many times. I’m often tempted to answer programming questions of the form “How do I do X …” by saying, “Yeah. Do that.” This is basically my answer. If you have implemented a button in PyGame, that means you’ve drawn some visual, and designated some area around that as a hot zone where a mouse click in that area means you have activated the button. If you want to move it, move where you did the draw and where the hot zone is. When I do this, I always give the button a position and draw the button imagery and set the hot zone relative to that position, so for me, moving a button is as simple as updating the position and invoking a redraw. For you maybe it’s different? Since I don’t know how you implemented your button, I can’t say more.
